review.title: Cereal location lots of comforts cramped room
review.reviewText: Good stay air conditioning was off whenever I left the room.
Great hotel in the heart of the city. Enjoyed a 3 day/2 night stay prior to taking a cruise.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Location, nice lobby, bar, lounge and restaurant on the ground floor. Lovely Patio Bar/Cafe on the 10th floor with a view of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: At checking, the desk had no record of our expedia reservation.  They non-the-less accepted our proof of reservation and found us fine accommodations.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to shopping, museums, government buildings. Toured the town and made a wine-tasking journey out of the city,

review.title: Excellent location to main downtown area.
review.reviewText: We could easily walk to most points of interest and were close to metro lines if needed. Enjoyed the Hotel and the large lobby and common areas. I found it a little confusing that the elevator could not access the pool/fitness area from the room floor! Overall it was a pleasant experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location! Also the breakfast was very good. The best orange juice that I have ever had!
review.negativeRemarks: Instructions near lobby computer(s) for English conversion. Bath mats in showers would be a security safety plus and toilet brushes would be a thankfu
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to the main Plaza Square where lots of activities and sights are available. e.g. speakers corner, band shell, chess players, artists etc.

review.title: a feel of old elegance in this hotel
review.reviewText: Very helpful people at the desk.  We spoke no Spanish but most of the staff spoke excellent English.  The formal dining room was excellent but not inexpensive.  Comparable to what fine dining would cost at home.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent breakfast included with our room cost.
review.negativeRemarks: One day our room was not made up til about 3:30 pm.  It was a day when we were not out of the hotel for the full day so had to make use of the lobby
review.locationRemarks: very central, 5 blocks to the central square and walkable to many museums.  lots of commercial nearby.

review.title: Nice place.
review.reviewText: We were staying for one night after the cruise.  It was a line for check-in, but they offered some some cold refreshments; like champagne and juices.  The stuff is pretty helpful. Room is nice and clean,  Wi-fi is  good.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to The Plaza De Armas. La Moneda Palace, Metropolitan Cathedral and transportation.

review.title: Very good position.
review.reviewText:
Close to shops and for hop on hop off bus.

Nice breakfasts.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very helpful.

review.title: OK hotel in city center
review.reviewText: Hotel décor a bit dated. All good except air conditioning not working and hotel charging $ 10.00 for the bottle of water which was placed in the room. Glass of wine in the bar was cheaper. It did not make any sense!
review.positiveRemarks: Loaction

review.title: centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: centrally located, clean, warm and courteous staff. we arrived early from the US and they were able to accommodate us into our room early
review.positiveRemarks: location! location!
review.locationRemarks:
plaza de Armas. historic district
in between 2 metro stops so you can get anywhere

review.title: Plaza San Franciso close to everything
review.reviewText: Although we arrived early the staff welcomed us and made sure our room was ready.  The hotel is close to many of the city highlights we visited on the next day's city highlights tour (Plaza de Armas, La Monera, Santa Lucia, and the pedestrian shopping area).  The complementary breakfast items were hot when they were supposed to be and well presented.
review.positiveRemarks: See the above

review.title: Convenient central hotel
review.reviewText: Helpful staff.  Food in the dining room was good, but sometimes the service in the dining room was very slow.  Staff in other areas - housekeeping, reception etc could not be faulted.
review.positiveRemarks: 5 star comfort, good room, location next to Londres and Paris, as well as being right by Church of San Francisco and Museum.
review.locationRemarks: 38 Londres was Pinochet's detention and torture house.  Avenida is central street right outside.  Handy for Plaza de Armas museums and cathedral.

review.title: South America Holiday
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our hotel, the staff was excellent, went out of their way to make sure everything was taken care of. The meals in the hotel were very good and we did not utilize other places, ate most of our meals within the hotel  Very pleased with our choice of hotels
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to most places ,shopping ,sightseeing,and on a veryu nice area of town

review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Hotel San Francisco.  The location was excellent.  The room, staff, food and drink were all excellent as well.  We can highly recommend this hotel in Saantiago.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked everything regarding this hotel!!
review.negativeRemarks: We have no recommendations to recommend.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent for dinning, sightseeing and shopping.

review.title: Clean hotel in central Santiago
review.reviewText:
Hotel is centrally located and very clean.  Our room on the 11th floor was very comfortable and clean.  The only negative was the quality of the towels.  They were thin and seems well used and should be replaced with larger, more plush towels.
The buffet breakfasts were adequate, however not the quality we would have expected.  There could be better food preparation and selection.  The dining room staff do not seem to anticipate peoples' needs and it seemed to take an inordinate amount of time for them to deliver on your requests.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness of room and central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Better service and quality of the food in the dining room.
review.locationRemarks: Very central and therefore within walking distance to all things located in the heart of the downtown of Santiago.

review.title: Nice hotel in Santiago
review.reviewText: Good location in the center of the city. Staff were very helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable. We were pleased with the accommodation and service.

review.title: Amazingness in downtown Santiago !
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel - amazing location - amazing staff - what a great experience !

review.title: Lovely hotel in a good location
review.reviewText:
We had two nights at this hotel at the end of a three week holiday to South America.
It was lovely to stay somewhere really nice and enjoy a little bit of luxury before the big trip home.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location and the comfortable rooms and helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks:
it was only a few blocks to the main square and there was some good shopping nearby
We also took a taxi to a big new mall and that was great.

review.title: Great Location in downtown
review.reviewText: Friendly, excellent breakfast included, knowledgable staff

review.title: Downtown - location not so nice
review.reviewText: Had to stay in 3 rooms in 6 days - terrible plumbing problem, bathroom sink breaks & falls, faucet handle not functioning. toilet not flushing, smelly room, etc. Hotel manager not willing to discuss problems.
review.positiveRemarks: Dining area nice. Front desk staff ok.
review.locationRemarks: Location not up-scale, but close to metro, shopping, and some plazas.

review.title: An Oasis of Tranquility with in The hectic City
review.reviewText:
Its my home away from home for
Many years.
Comfort, Service and The hospitalité. They Know what guests expect.

review.title: Spacious in central Santiago
review.reviewText: We had a suite. Very good value. spacious and luxurious. We would definitely go back.
review.positiveRemarks: location, foyer, breakfast and of course our suite was superb

review.title: Reunion with daughter!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel right in downtown Santiago. Staff were very nice, food was excellent. Huge breakfast provided every morning. Only down side, my husband thought room was too hot.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, proximity to downtown.
review.locationRemarks: Right in heart of downtown. Close to various forms of transportation. Close enough to walk to restaurants or shopping.

review.title: Great location in downtown Santiago
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located in downtown Santiago, walking distance to all sightseeing attractions such as La Moneda, Plaza de Armas, etc. It is located within walking distance to metro station Universidad de Chile, from where you can virtually go anywhere in Santiago.
The hotel is nice but the staff at the front desk are not quite friendly and actually are a bit rude, they didn't welcome us as we expected for the rating of the hotel. My husband and I were given a room in the 10th floor, which was a triple bedroom, no desk, no sofa, so we requested to be changed of room. We were given then a room in floor 3, which was great because it was quite spacious and had a balcony/terraza with lovely view to the streets of Santiago.
Buffet breakfast was nice, variety of foods were served, although it can get quite busy and waiters are not always ready to help.
I would recommend anyone who travels for business or pleasure to stay at Plaza San Francisco, from the hotels I've stayed in Santiago, it is truly one of the best ones (especially when it comes to location).
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location, right in the heart of Santiago's downtown. All sightseeing attractions are within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff members were not friendly and we felt were actually not properly trained for a hotel this rating. We were not welcomed nor thanked for our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Visit La Moneda, Plaza de Armas, Cerro Santa Lucia, Paseo Ahumada, Mercado Central.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel - good position, friendly and helpful staff, clean and attractive rooms. I'd definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms, staff, food

review.title: Revived and ready to travel
review.reviewText:
After travelling South America with a friend for over 6 weeks, we booked the hotel for our last night for a relaxing and rejuvenating night before the long journey back to Australia the next day. We enjoyed the service and rooms, and the breakfast was good - it met our expectations for South America noting that it is typically quite different from a full western style a la carte or even buffet breakfast in terms of the offerings. We were very pleased with the comfort and style of the hotel, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and the price. We were also very pleased with a 1.30pm check out so that we could enjoy a fully relaxing sleep in.

The only disappointment was that despite checking in on a week day, the hotel was unable to offer an express service for laundry, as they required more than 24 hours to return laundry and we were leaving the following afternoon. Also phone calls were incredibly expensive, as was the mini bar (somewhat to be expected). Eating at the Italian restaurant next door was pleasant and about 1/3 the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable beds; we booked twin share and were pleased to discover two double beds. Good pillows was another nice surprise!
review.negativeRemarks: The inability to provide an express laundry service, and the cost of the phone calls, which was beyond exorbitant.
review.locationRemarks: Good location down town, close to the mall and public transport. Didn't have time to explore too far.

review.title: Nice hotel in centro Santiago
review.reviewText: The location is great , walking distance to many places. hotel is older, but nicely kept, the personnel very nice and helpful. I had made an arrangement with hotel to have their taxista to pick me up at the airport since my flight was scheduled at 11.30 pm and even though I finally got out of customs (due to flight delay and suitcase not arriving) at about 1.45 am, the driver was still there waiting for me (I did call the hotel though when waiting for luggage and told I am late) . Breakfast room on Sunday morning was quite a zoo, since the hotel was fully booked, but the buffet was very good, even though you had to wait for some replenishment to arrive, service was great though. Internet worked well and the bed was comfortable

review.title: The best in Santiago downtown
review.reviewText:
Great location, Breakfast, Parking, Internet.
I will stay at Hotel Plaza San Francisco during my next trip to Santiago.
100 % recommended
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms and The Restaurant

review.title: Lovely, safe and tradtional hotel in Santiago
review.reviewText: This is a lovely, safe, traditional hotel in the old center of Santiago. The check-in was fast, room clean and complimentary breakfast ample. Instead of having a glitzy or hip vibe, the hotel has old world ambience, down to the paintings in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: The traditional vibe, the bi-lingual staff"
review.negativeRemarks: OK, the carpet, but not a deal breaker!"

review.title: There was hair in the tub when I walked in to take a shower!!!!!
review.reviewText:
Horrible hotel!

Really bad food (if is just to say that you have food, don't have a menu!!)

They did try to make it up for the hair in the tub by giving me a bottle of wine...

but PLEASE!!!

I bought some alchool and sprayed all over the room... the only think that I could think is how disgusted I felt when I saw that dirty bathroom!

HORRIBLE!!!!!!!

My friends stayed at Neruda ... in comparison to this one a MUCH better option ...

review.title: Acceptable
review.reviewText: Room service had to be asked few times to bring all bathroom utilities. Otherwise not to much to complain except restaurant service always asking wether they should replace (very) dirty tablecloth.
